util

Interface ThemeFinder

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ThemeFinderImpl

    public interface ThemeFinder
    We will use this interface to return themes. The interface decouples the imp due to the fact that today we are using xml serialisation, but tomorrow we may be looking these up from a database
    Author:
    Tony

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ArrayList<Path> returnDirectories(Path rootDir, String fileType, int numLevels)
      When passed a root directory, filetype to search for, and a numbr of folder levels to iterate, will return the instances of that filetype found, as paths, that exist given those criteria
      Theme returnTheme(String theme)
      When passed the name of a theme will obtain it from the persitence store it and return it as a Theme
      ArrayList<Theme> returnThemes()
      Uses the theme root directory specified in theme, and returnDriectories() here, to find themes on the persistence store

    • Method Detail

      • returnTheme

        Theme returnTheme(String theme)
                  throws IOException
        When passed the name of a theme will obtain it from the persitence store it and return it as a Theme
        Parameters:
        theme - the name of the Theme to return
        Returns:
        a Theme
        Throws:
        IOException - if the Theme cannot be accessed from the persistence store

      • returnThemes

        ArrayList<Theme> returnThemes()
                              throws IOException
        Uses the theme root directory specified in theme, and returnDriectories() here, to find themes on the persistence store
        Returns:
        a list of the themes found
        Throws:
        IOException - if any Theme cannot be accessed from the persistence store

      • returnDirectories

        ArrayList<Path> returnDirectories(Path rootDir,
                                String fileType,
                                int numLevels)
                                  throws IOException
        When passed a root directory, filetype to search for, and a numbr of folder levels to iterate, will return the instances of that filetype found, as paths, that exist given those criteria
        Parameters:
        rootDir - starting directory
        fileType - file type to search for (ie: postfix of filename)
        numLevels - levels below starting directory to recurse
        Returns:
        a list of paths which contain the given filetype from the root directory to the specified number of levels
        Throws:
        IOException - if the location cannot be read
